page.title: 04A Preservation Society.
page.content: The Bramshott and Liphook Preservation Society registered as an amenity society and founded in 1967 is supported by one tenth of the local population. As well as its enthusiasm for investigating the watermeadows,the society helps local parish councils to protect footpaths and bridleways. A booklet published in 1983 'Walks Around Liphook 'includes 3 in this area. The Ramblers Association Journal noted it as a model for Footpath Guides. The Society is 'surveying' possible ancient tracks and ancient woodlands at the request of the County planning department. Keen walkers support the fortnightly guided rambles and a marathon to Chichester may become an annual event.Small groups quietly enjoy the noted but not public historic houses. Liphook matters too are of concern.
